item.title: How To Unlock Sadness In Disney Dreamlight Valley (Get Up And Glow Quest)
item.description:
Sadness is the other emotion players can invite back to the village in Disney Dreamlight Valley . Similar to Joy, Sadness requires your help with setting up the stage for the dream production before moving in with Joy in the Remote Headquarters. Here's where to find all Pop Concert Musical Memories and unlock Sadness in DDV .

How To Unlock Sadness In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

To unlock Sadness, Dreamers must complete the Get Up And Glow quest in DDV . Return to the Inside Out Realm and speak with Sadness to proceed with the quest. She says you need to go further into the Long Term Memory to help Riley. Go there and talk with emotion again to figure out the next step, which is collecting the Pop Concert Musical Memories.

They are memories found on shelves and some are locked behind puzzles in Disney Dreamlight Valley . So, make sure to understand how to solve the puzzles to finish the quest.

All Pop Concert Musical Memories Locations In DDV - Disney Dreamlight Valley

Pop Concert Musical Memories Location #1

After breaking the first set of stones, approach the shelves on the left and grab the first Pop Concert Musical Memory.

Pop Concert Musical Memories Location #2

Continue forward to find two blocked paths by some routing control puzzles in DDV . Turn left along the open passageway to find the second memory on a shelf to the right.

Pop Concert Musical Memories Location #3

Turn around and head towards the routing controls on the right as the left is missing a button. Destroy the rock and solve the puzzle by pressing the middle console, then press the one on the right to reveal a path. Proceed forward to get a Pop Concert Musical Memory as well as the missing red button from one of the rocks.

Pop Concert Musical Memories Location #4

Return the button to its routing control console and follow these steps to complete the puzzle; press the one in the middle, then the one on the left side, and finally the right side . Go inside and grab the fourth musical memory.

Speak with Sadness, who guides players to the Recall Tube to put down the memories and send them to HQ. Now that everything is ready, go to the Dream Production set again to try a different approach.

Sadness asks Dreamers to decorate the stage with six pop concert items and dress in a Bold outfit. For the required items, grab the two speakers, two lights, DJ station, and the small red canon. Wear whatever you like within the given theme and use the mic to end the day.

Talk with the emotion to find out everything went well, and now you can ask Sadness to join the valley, which completes the Get Up And Glow Up quest in DDV .

item.title: Fortnite: Blitz Mobile Cup Guide (Get NITE Unit Marksman Skin Free)
item.description:
Fortnite hosts tournaments across most of its game modes, allowing players to put their skills to the test and battle it out for great prizes, whether it's in-game cosmetics or money. Blitz is Fortnite 's most recent permanent game mode, and it was an instant hit among fans. Now, Fortnite wants to test out how it would work competitively and on mobile.

Gamers who want to help Epic Games test out competitive games in Blitz Mode will have a unique chance to win a free skin. This guide will go into detail about how to get the NITE Unit Marksman skin in Fortnite , so fans can make sure they don't miss this opportunity.

How to Get the NITE Unit Marksman in Fortnite

Fortnite is giving away the NITE Unit Marksman skin for a limited-time, and it is currently unknown if it will be seen again in the future. To get the NITE Unit Marksman in Fortnite , players have to participate in the Solo Blitz Mobile Cup and be among the top players in their region .

There are other free cosmetics that players can get by playing this cup. The First Response Tac Pack back bling can be obtained by scoring 5 points, the Gavel Banger emote requires them to get 20 points, but the NITE Unit Tac Axe pickaxe also requires players to get a top placement in their region. Here is how well players must do in the Solo Blitz Mobile Cup to get the NITE Unit Marksman skin and the NITE Unit Tac Axe pickaxe:

item.title: ROG Xbox Ally Reveals Handheld Compatibility Program
item.description:
ROG Xbox Ally has announced the Handheld Compatibility Program, which will help players conveniently identify games that have been optimized for Windows handhelds. Mimicking Valve's own program for identifying "Deck Verified" games, this new feature introduced by the ROG Xbox Ally aims to facilitate handheld gaming on Microsoft's OS.

After successfully entering the handheld gaming PC market in 2023, Asus is now set to continue in this segment with more powerful offerings. Excitingly, this time the tech giant has partnered with Xbox to provide a better console gaming-like experience. The ROG Xbox Ally and ROG Xbox Ally X are the Phil Spencer-led company's first foray into handhelds of any kind. While the Xbox Ally X is the top-tier variant, the Xbox Ally is the more affordable but less powerful variant.

ROG Xbox Ally Introduces Handheld Compatibility Program, Taking a Page Out of Steam Deck's Book

Xbox recently explained the Handheld Compatibility Program, one of the new features present in both the ROG Xbox Ally and the ROG Xbox Ally X. Essentially, it is the console giant's effort to make PC games that offer an optimal, out-of-the-box experience on Windows handhelds easily discoverable. According to the company, its goal is to let Xbox Ally owners quickly find games that can be played right away without the need to tinker with the game's settings too much. As part of the program, games will be labeled "Handheld Optimized" if they support default controller inputs, appropriate text readability, accurately sized icons, an optimized text input method, and a suitable resolution in the new full-screen mode. On the other hand, titles that fall just short of these requirements and need minor tweaks before jumping in will be labeled as "Mostly Compatible."

To make the process of searching for Handheld Optimized games seamless, players will be able to use a filter within the game library on ROG Xbox Ally devices. Moreover, to make it easier to search for games that also run seamlessly on these handhelds, there will be a "Windows Performance Fit" indicator that will let the players know what kind of in-game performance to expect from a game in advance.

Games primarily built for standard-sized PCs don't always translate into a good handheld experience. However, Xbox and Asus aren't the first mainstream companies to realize that, as Valve had thought along the same lines for its Steam Deck. And, it is quite easy to spot the similarities between ROG Xbox Ally's Handheld Compatibility Program and its Steam Deck counterpart, which is responsible for labeling "Deck Verified" titles. This suggests that Xbox and Asus may have taken notes from Valve before devising such a program tailored for their handheld.

With ROG Xbox Ally finally confirmed to hit the shelves on October 16, a new era for Xbox is ready to kick off. If the co-branded device does well, it might even prompt the console maker to eventually come up with a dedicated Xbox handheld. Since Sony has also been rumored to be making a proper comeback in this category, the handheld space could be the next battleground for the PlayStation vs Xbox debate in the future.

item.title: Resident Evil Kicks off 30th Anniversary Celebrations with New Artwork
item.description:
The Resident Evil franchise is beginning the approach to its 30th anniversary, and Capcom is celebrating by unveiling a new piece of artwork. The new art features a number of the series' leading protagonists, including the newest addition to the Resident Evil cast, Grace Ashcroft.

Survival horror fans are getting more excited for Resident Evil Requiem , the next main-series entry to the franchise. Resident Evil Requiem unveiled a new trailer during Gamescom Opening Night Live, and first impressions of the title from those who have gone hands-on largely seem to be pleased with it. Resident Evil Requiem will be launching just before the official 30th anniversary of the original Resident Evil , but Capcom is already prepping for the occasion now.

Resident Evil Reveals New Artwork in Honor of 30th Anniversary

Capcom has now opened a new webpage in honor of the series' 30th anniversary. While there's very little on the page so far, as the anniversary won't technically begin until 2026, the series has unveiled a new piece of artwork featuring some of the series' most popular protagonists. The image showcases Leon S. Kennedy, Claire Redfield, Chris Redfield, Jill Valentine, newcomer Grace Ashcroft, and Ada Wong, in an illustrated Art Nouveau style. Each character is pictured seated on a throne, with elements of some of the biggest antagonists they've had to face placed behind them. For example, Claire is shown with a Licker lurking behind her, while Jill and Leon get elements of Nemesis and Mr. X, respectively.

The art seems to be based on the most recent appearances of these characters in the franchise, so series leads like Leon, Claire, and Jill resemble their Resident Evil Remake character designs. While each character is wearing an outfit similar to one they've been seen in over the course of the games, they've been given a more high-fashion-style overhaul, with every protagonist's outfit featuring gold filigrees and accessories. It's not clear if these designs will be utilized in any actual game or other promotional material at this time.

What Capcom has planned for Resident Evil 's 30th anniversary overall remains to be seen. Resident Evil Survival Unit will release sometime in 2025, with Requiem following in early 2026. These two titles should provide fans with quite a bit to keep them involved in the survival horror series, but it's likely not all that Capcom has in the works. Many fans are still hoping to see Resident Evil 0 or Resident Evil Code: Veronica remakes announced, which could possibly be announced as part of the celebrations. Series fans should stay tuned for more information to be revealed in the months to come.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem May Offer the Freedom of Choice, But There's Clearly a Favorite Child
item.description:
Lucky Gamescom attendees have gotten the chance to check out a hands-on preview of Resident Evil Requiem , and the teaser has offered a little taste of the horrors that await next year. Resident Evil Requiem has been one of the biggest announcements of the year, so far, and anticipation is now stronger than ever.

Resident Evil Requiem has confirmed several exciting features that are subverting expectations. A brand-new protagonist with Grace Ashcroft and the long-awaited return to Raccoon City are promising a compelling story, but one of the most intriguing features is the option to swap between first-person and third-person perspectives. Traditionally, the Resident Evil franchise has been a third-person series, but that all changed with the arrival of RE7 . Now, Resident Evil Requiem aims to give players the best of both worlds, but based on the game's various previews, it's quickly becoming clear that first-person is still the preferred choice.

Resident Evil Requiem Allows Freedom of Choice, But First-Person Brings the Biggest Scares

  • Resident Evil Requiem launches on February 27, 2026.
  • The game will be available for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S.

Director Koshi Nakanishi Has a Soft Spot for First-Person Horror

Nakanishi was also the director of RE7 , which set in motion the divisive switch to first-person. Back in 2017, when promoting RE7 in an interview with BBC, Nakanishi explained the reasoning behind the new perspective, stating, "The first-person perspective just seemed to be the right way to go in order to have a fresh-feeling, modern, immersive take on survival horror." In the same interview, he adds, "I wanted to bring to this game the feeling of opening the door and not knowing what's going to be on the other side." There is still plenty of mystery surrounding Resident Evil Requiem , but it's easy to conclude from the game's trailers and sneak peeks that Nakanishi still holds that affinity for first-person over third-person.

Grace's mother Alyssa was murdered at the Wrenwood Hotel eight years prior to the game's events.

Requiem Trailers Focus on First-Person

There have been snippets of third-person moments showcased, but overall, much of the gameplay has been shown through Grace's own perspective. The setting of Requiem is far different from RE7 , but what has been revealed of the former still boasts the sweat-inducing claustrophobia of the latter.

The cramped hallways of the Wrenwood Hotel and the Gamescom demo's Rhodes Hill Chronic Care Center feel far more oppressive when experienced in first-person. The stifled atmosphere combined with Resident Evil Requiem 's horrifying new stalker enemy that lumbers through the halls really gets the heart rate elevated. Granted, this still looks terrifying in third-person, but first-person is bound to be the best way to experience each scare how it was truly intended to be felt.

Rumors have claimed that Leon S. Kennedy is set to return as a surprise second protagonist, but Capcom has yet to confirm this.

Requiem's Third-Person Maintains the Scares in a Clever Way

While first-person is easily the scariest option, those who prefer a third-person Resident Evil game will still get a solid dose of scares. When playing in third-person, Requiem features a trip mechanic that enhances the tension. As Grace tries to run away from the grotesque stalker, she can trip and fall, which adds an extra layer of dread to the perspective. So, while third-person is a safer option to keep one's heart palpitations at bay, Requiem makes sure to still force players into a terrifying encounter.

Ultimately, it all boils down to a player's preference, but for those who want to experience the game at its most terrifying, then first-person is likely to be the best option. Resident Evil Requiem could be a game-changer for the series, as it introduces a brand-new chapter and expands upon the lore of Raccoon City. Only time will tell, but as of now, Requiem is promising to be a terror-filled adventure.
